name: sfchronicle
text:
Airbnb filed to go public Monday in a long-anticipated offering that defied the pandemic. Though it will generate billions of dollars for its founders and investors, it’s unlikely to have much effect on the already-hot real estate market.
https://t.co/z1DZSkzsx5

text: The United States now has lost more than 247,000 lives to the coronavirus, a milestone crossed Monday, according to researchers at Johns Hopkins University. https://t.co/TlhUvxkJFv

text: Officials began recovery efforts Monday to retrieve a barge that sank in front of a salvage yard in the Petaluma River Sunday morning, sending first responders scrambling to prevent potential petroleum leaks and damage to the waterway. https://t.co/2SwYAFNnN6

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @hknightsf: My latest: One of the pandemic’s silver linings in San Francisco — the closure of the Great Highway to cars — is at risk. @D4GordonMar wants real traffic calming in the Sunset from @sfmta_muni by next month or he’ll push for the return of cars on weekdays. https://t.co/oe8Hjor3pR
